DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine if Selective Adsorption System for Removal of Bacterial Toxins (S.A.F.E.BT) therapy is effective in the treatment of severe sepsis.
DOC.brief_title: S.A.F.E.BT System Extracorporeal Treatment With DIAPACT CRRT
DOC.detailed_description: Is extracorporeal treatment effective in the treatment of sepsis
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Clinical diagnosis of Sepsis Mechanical ventilation due to acute pulmonary dysfunction One additional (second) acute sepsisrelated organ dysfunction Exclusion Criteria Pregnant women and nursing mothers Conditions or medications associated with an increased risk of bleeding/complications from anticoagulation Previous episode of sepsis during this hospitalization PaO2/FiO2 ratio < 300 Severe granulocytopenia (leukocytes <500 / Î¼l) Acute hepatic diseases or severe liver failure or cirrhosis Chronic cardiovascular disease precluding extracorporeal treatment Human immunodeficiency virus complicated by AIDS defining illness Evidence of active bleeding uncontrolled hemorrhage
